nl.inl.blacklab.search.results

Class DocGroups

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.results.Results<DocGroup>
      • nl.inl.blacklab.search.results.DocGroups
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<DocGroup>, ResultGroups<DocResult>, SearchResult

    public class DocGroups
extends Results<DocGroup>
implements ResultGroups<DocResult>
    Applies grouping to the results in a DocResults object.

        Construct a DocGroups from a list of groups.
        Parameters:
        queryInfo - query info
        groups - list of groups to wrap
        groupBy - what the documents were grouped by
        sampleParameters - sample parameters if this is a sample, null otherwise
        windowStats - window stats if this is a window, null otherwise
        Returns:
        document groups

      • sort

        public <P extends ResultProperty<DocGroup>> DocGroups sort(P sortProp)
        Description copied from class: Results
        Return a new Results object with these results sorted by the given property. This keeps the existing sort (or lack of one) intact and allows you to cache different sorts of the same resultset. The result objects are reused between the two Results instances, so not too much additional memory is used.
        Specified by:
        sort in class Results<DocGroup>
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the property to sort on
        Returns:
        a new Results object with the same results, sorted in the specified way

      • window

        public DocGroups window(int first,
                        int number)
        Description copied from class: Results
        Get a window into this list of results. Use this if you're displaying part of the resultset, like in a paging interface. It makes sure BlackLab only works with the results you want to display and doesn't do any unnecessary processing on the other hits. The resulting instance will has "window stats" to assist with paging, like figuring out if there hits before or after the window.
        Specified by:
        window in class Results<DocGroup>
        Parameters:
        first - first result in the window (0-based)
        number - desired size of the window (if there's enough results)
        Returns:
        the window

      • ensureResultsRead

        protected void ensureResultsRead(int number)
        Description copied from class: Results
        Ensure that we have read at least as many results as specified in the parameter.
        Specified by:
        ensureResultsRead in class Results<DocGroup>
        Parameters:
        number - the minimum number of results that will have been read when this method returns (unless there are fewer hits than this); if negative, reads all hits

      • withFewerStoredResults

        public DocGroups withFewerStoredResults(int maximumNumberOfResultsPerGroup)
        Description copied from interface: ResultGroups
        Get an instance of this grouping with fewer stored results per group. This won't affect the group sizes, just the number of results that are stored per group.
        Specified by:
        withFewerStoredResults in interface ResultGroups<DocResult>
        Parameters:
        maximumNumberOfResultsPerGroup - maximum number of results to store, or -1 for the same
        Returns:
        new grouping with fewer stored results

      • doneProcessingAndCounting

        public boolean doneProcessingAndCounting()
        Description copied from class: Results
        Check if we're done retrieving/counting hits. If you're retrieving hits in a background thread, call this method from another thread to check if all hits have been processed.
        Specified by:
        doneProcessingAndCounting in class Results<DocGroup>
        Returns:
        true iff all hits have been retrieved/counted.

      • getGroupMap

        Specified by:

      • numberOfResultObjects

        public int numberOfResultObjects()
        Description copied from interface: SearchResult
        How many result objects does this search store? Used for estimating the cache size. Hits make up most of the storage of results objects, and they should take 24 bytes of memory, so we can use this number to make a reasonable approximation of memory usage. Note that this number can be misleading, because Hit objects are shared between results objects. But it's the best we have at the moment.
        Specified by:
        numberOfResultObjects in interface SearchResult
        Returns:
        how many hits are stored in this result object
